H0.text: which continents were part of the roman empire. Africa

H1.text: which continents were part of the roman empire. Asia

H2.text: which continents were part of the roman empire. North America

H3.text: which continents were part of the roman empire. Europe

A4.text: The Roman Empire controlled the Mediterranean and much of Europe, Western Asia, and North Africa.

A5.text: Roman Africa or Roman North Africa is the culture of Roman Africans that developed from 146 BC, when the Roman Republic defeated Carthage and the Punic Wars ended, with subsequent institution of Roman Imperial government, through the 5th and 6th centuries AD under Byzantine Imperial control.
